block.p: Tian-Wei Dianna Chen, the daughter of Shu and Xia Chen of Manhattan, was married there yesterday to Haohui Wang, the son of Xiaoyan and Yucheng Wang of Brooklyn. The Rev. Jeffrey Earnshaw, a nondenominational minister, performed the ceremony.

Ms. Chen, 26, is keeping her name. She is an associate at Sullivan & Cromwell, the Manhattan law firm. She graduated from New York University and Brooklyn Law School. Mr. Wang, 26, is a computer consultant in the Manhattan offices of Deutsche Bank. He graduated from the State University at Buffalo.

Tian-Wei Dianna Chen, the daughter of Shu and Xia Chen of Manhattan, was married there yesterday to Haohui Wang, the son of Xiaoyan and Yucheng Wang of Brooklyn. The Rev. Jeffrey Earnshaw, a nondenominational minister, performed the ceremony.

Ms. Chen, 26, is keeping her name. She is an associate at Sullivan & Cromwell, the Manhattan law firm. She graduated from New York University and Brooklyn Law School. Mr. Wang, 26, is a computer consultant in the Manhattan offices of Deutsche Bank. He graduated from the State University at Buffalo.

The bride's father and the bridegroom's father both practice Chinese herbal medicine in Manhattan. The bride's mother is an assistant at her husband's practice. The bridegroom's mother, who is retired, was a seamstress at SMC Fashions, a clothing manufacturer in Manhattan.
